---
title: "Urbanization vs. Population Growth"
---

Do more urbanized countries experience higher population growth?

This page explores the relationship between the urbanization rate and population growth rate in four Latin American countries: Colombia, Brazil, Argentina, and Mexico. It compares how different levels of urban development may lead to differences in population growth.

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import sqlite3
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Connect to sql
conn = sqlite3.connect('data/wdi_data.db')  

# SQL query
query = """
SELECT 
    country,
    urban_population_percent,
    rural_population_percent,
    population_growth
FROM wdi_data
WHERE 
    urban_population_percent IS NOT NULL 
    AND population_growth IS NOT NULL
"""
df = pd.read_sql_query(query, conn)

display(pd.read_sql(query, conn))

```

```{python}
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.scatterplot(
    data=df,
    x="urban_population_percent",
    y="population_growth",
    hue="country",
)

plt.xlabel("Urban Population (%)")
plt.ylabel("Population Growth Rate (%)")
plt.title("Urbanization vs Population Growth Rate")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

```
